name: Engineer Software Quality 1_San Diego

contents:
What We Do
At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.

Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.

Who We Look For
Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.
What We Do At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. We change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas and solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Our engineering teams build scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategist groups, is at the critical center of our business. Our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here. Who We Look For Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. The Consumer and Commercial Banking Division(CCBD) brings innovative solutions to traditional banking activities. We are a global team of lenders, investors, risk managers, skilled marketers, web experts and banking specialists. We provide a suite of solutions to help our customers meet their financial goals. We make direct investments in and manage risk for a portfolio of corporate loans and securities. We help transform distressed communities through investments and loans of private capital. Commercial Banking Commercial Banking, a business unit within CCBD, aims to provide comprehensive cash management solutions for corporations. CCBD Commercial Banking combines the strength and heritage of a 148-year-old financial institution with the agility and entrepreneurial spirit of a tech start-up. Our goal is to provide the best client experience. Through the use of modern technologies centered on data and analytics, we provide customers with powerful tools that are grounded in value, transparency and simplicity to improve cash flow management efficiency.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL
• Data and Liquidity Analytics is a global team (NewYork/London/Bengaluru) responsible for building the data platform for the Commercial Banking suite of applications. The data platform will power all our tools, reports and analytics including our liquidity analytics. These models and tools allow efficient cash flow analysis and are of primary importance for our clients.
• As part of our global team, you will drive the development and the delivery of our data platform. This is a leadership role with the expectation that you will understand our product roadmap, foster an engineering culture, hire and grow talent and deliver a high quality data platform for our clients. This initiative is of critical important to the success of the organization and our roadmap. Services like liquidity analytics, billing, client onboarding, reporting and others will rely on the data platform. Accurate, granular, complete and timely data will be our key differentiating factor and competitive advantage in the market place. We expect the successful candidate to deliver in lock step with rest of the application development teams and to establish strong partnerships with peers.
• Manage multiple tasks and use sound judgment when prioritizing

• Collaborate with global cross functional team in building customer-centric products

• Analyze existing software implementations to identify areas of improvement and provide deadline estimates for implementing new features

• Update and maintain documentation for team processes, best practices and software runbooks

• Establish trusted partnerships with peers, product heads, and executive level stakeholders

• Must be passionate about technology and engineering

• Exceptional analytical skills and ability to apply knowledge and experience in decision-making to arrive at creative and commercial solutions

• Ability to leverage technology to deliver business value

• Must be independent and comfortable in a fast paced, ambiguous and often multi-directional work environment

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR
• Minimum 2 years of relevant professional experience using a modern programming language (preferably Java/Scala)
• B.S. or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)
• Experience leveraging test driven development technics
• Comfort with Agile operating models
• Team oriented
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills
• Energetic, self-directed, and self-motivated

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience with microservice architecture
• Experience with Kafka, MongoDB, Hadoop, Cassandra
• Experience with AWS
• Experience in Financial Services or Fintech

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.

Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2018. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

contents:
At HP, talent is our criteria. Join us in reinventing the standard for diversity and inclusion. Bring your awesomeness, and just be you!

Applies intermediate level of subject matter knowledge to solve a variety of common business issues. Works on problems of moderately complex scope. Acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input. Exercises independent judgment within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate action. Follows established guidelines and interprets policies. Evaluates unique circumstances and makes recommendations.

Responsibilities:

  • Designs limited enhancements, updates, and programming changes for portions and subsystems of end-user applications software running on local, networked, and Internet- based platforms.
  • Analyzes design and determines coding, programming, and integration activities required based on specific objectives and established project guidelines.
  • Executes and writes portions of testing plans, protocols, and documentation for assigned portion of application; identifies and debugs issues with code and suggests changes or improvements.
  • Participates as a member of project team of other software applications engineers and internal and outsourced development partners to develop reliable, cost effective and high quality solutions for assigned applications portion or subsystem.
  • Collaborates and communicates with internal and outsourced development partners regarding software applications design status, project progress, and issue resolution.


Education and Experience Required:
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent.
  • Typically 0-4 years experience; recent college graduates will be considered


Knowledge and Skills:
  • Using software applications design tools and languages.
  • bility to apply analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Designing software applications running on multiple platform types.
  • Software applications testing methodology, including execution of test plans, debugging, and testing scripts and tools.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.
  • Ability to effectively communicate design proposals and negotiate options.

contents:
What We Do

At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Who We Look For

Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.

OUR IMPACT

Our team of engineers builds solutions to the most complex problems. We develop cutting-edge systems and processes that form the core of our key business and enable transactions to move in milliseconds. We provide real-time access to critical deal information and crunch billions of data points each day to inform firm-wide market insights and strategies. Team members have the opportunity to work at the forefront of technology innovation alongside industry leaders and make significant contributions to the field. Compliance Technology provides technology solutions to help Compliance manage the firm's regulatory and reputational risks, and enables them to advise and assist the firm's businesses.



YOUR IMPACT

The role involves analyzing and developing technical solutions to address regulations and policies in GSAM Compliance space. GSAM Compliance Technology provides solutions to help Compliance manage the firm's regulatory and reputational risks, and enables them to advise and assist the firm's businesses. Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems has an opening for an Embedded Software Engineer 2 to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in Redondo Beach, CA. Candidate will need to be able to obtain and maintainclearance with ability to obtain program clearance (SCI/SAP).

The selected candidate will develop flexible software solutions for hard real time, resource constrained systems. Development areas span 1) Distributed architectures based on common components, 2) Data management (file systems, and data reduction strategies), 3) Command & telemetry processing, 4) Automated verification. Languages employed include C++ and Python. The selected candidate will also help support interface development, creation of design documentation, and test planning.

The selected candidate should thrive in a fast-paced work environment with high expectations, significantly diverse assignments, heavy multi-tasking, collaborative/team settings across all levels. Candidate must be comfortable in a lab environment and be able to collaborate closely with system engineers, hardware designers, and integration/test engineers.

name: Software Engineer 2/3

contents:
Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you'll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones. We continue to revolutionize how people create, deliver, and enjoy entertainment worldwide. To do that, we need the absolute best talent. We're big enough to give you all the resources you need, and small enough so you can make a real difference and earn recognition for your work. We offer a collegial culture, challenging projects, and excellent compensation and benefits.


As an Embedded Audio Software Staff Engineeron a high impact strategic initiative beyond the core business, you will be responsible to design, implement, and port embedded audio software that enables the next generation of immersive entertainment experiences created by Dolby. The candidate hired for this position will be part of an engineering team based in San Francisco that works with innovative technologies in a fast-paced and creative environment. This is an ideal opportunity for someone who is passionate about technology and possesses an innate understanding of the principles that underpin good software design and employs these principles through the design process.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and develop audio algorithms intended for deployment in consumer electronics
  • Port algorithms to applicable embedded targets (DSP and ARM), with both fixed point and floating point targets
  • Optimize algorithms to ensure best performance while maintaining a low power consumption envelope
  • Work with engineering teams to integrate audio algorithms into actual products

To be Successful

The successful candidate will have prior experience with embedded audio software in the context of high volume consumer electronics. Your experience contributing to the designing, developing and porting to embedded projects will be important. Experience with end-to-end product development, including the SW integration in a HW environment will be valuable. Understanding the tools needed for embedded audio software product development and releases will be essential.

You will need to work effectively in a highly technical cross functional global environment interfacing directly with various technical leaders across Dolby.

Other Essential Skills Include

  • Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science (or equivalent) and 6-10 years experience.
  • Proficiency in developing software in C/C++.
  • Deep understanding of embedded audio software development.
  • Demonstrable experience designing and implementing audio processing signal chains.
  • Demonstrable experience developing efficient (memory, CPU and bandwidth) software for both floating and fixed point targets.
  • Demonstrable experience in control and configuration of the audio software from the applications layer.
  • Deep understanding of audio and digital signal processing.
  • Knowledge about interactions among UI layer to middleware and to kernel level is a plus.
  • Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python and LUA is a plus.
  • Familiarity with the tools used in assessing SW robustness.



Dolby will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code, Article 49, and Administrative Code, Article 12

Equal Employment Opportunity:
Dolby is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Our success depends on the combined skills and talents of all our employees. We are committed to making employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, marital status, family status, medical condition, disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances.

name: Embedded Audio Software Staff Engineer

contents:
Job Description

Who we want

Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.

Dedicated achievers. Relentless about quality, people who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure a project is complete and meets regulations and expectations.

Curious learners. Engineers who seek out cutting-edge research and information to expand and enhance their ability to develop software.

Goal-oriented developers. Keeping the customer and system requirements squarely in focus, people who deliver safe and robust solutions.

User-focused creators. Engineers who design with the user in mind, developing software that helps change patients' lives.

Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to develop best practices.

Motivated product launchers. Engineers who bring strategic direction and drive for execution to ensure products are developed and launched with precision.

What you will do

As a Design Engineer (Application Software) is responsible for the software system design of their product or subsystem from start to finish. You will provide design creation concepts to a new product development project to ensure design alignment with overall scope. Working in a cross functional team is a guarantee. Navigating your way through technical design discussions and ensuring appropriate analysis of decisions through application of sound engineering judgment and risk analysis will be the normal. This highly strategic role with broad organizational influence is a key part of ensuring overall product alignment with user needs and requirement specifications.

  • Learn, understand, and continue to grow fundamental knowledge of application software principles and practices. Utilize this knowledge of principles, practices, and procedures to ensure alignment of product design or subsystem design with requirements.
  • Under minimal supervision designs, develop, modify and evaluate software systems and/or software systems.
  • Hold active role in New Product Development team discussions. Provide engineering input on key topics to reduce time to market.
  • Evaluate product designs at a subsystem level and ensure appropriate performance based upon customer and standard requirements. Typical analysis includes sound coding structures and reviews.
  • Work with minimal supervision. Utilize senior engineers for discussion of unique software opportunities.
  • Determine and implement design approaches and parameters and conduct feasibility studies on new designs.
  • Analyze equipment to establish operating data, conduct experimental tests and evaluate the results. Select components and equipment based on analysis of specifications, reliability and regulatory requirements.
  • Provide periodic reports on assigned topics to supervisor.

What you need
  • Bachelors Degree in Computer engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
  • GPA minimum of 3.0, strongly preferred.
  • 0-5 years related design engineering experience.
  • Proficient in C and/or C++.
  • Proficient in communication protocols such as UART, SPI, and I2C.
  • Hands on experience with debugging tools such as debuggers, oscilloscopes, logic analyzers and multimeters.
  • Experience with linux
  • Experience with RTOS
  • Demonstrated ability to translate requirements to design
  • Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Excellent analytical skills.
  • Effective interpersonal communication skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to operate small hand tools (e.g. pliers, screwdrivers, hammer, wrenches, etc.), power tools and test/inspection equipment.
  • Demonstrated numerical problem solving skills.


Work From Home: No

Travel Percentage: Up to 25%

Stryker Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Stryker is an EO employer - M/F/Veteran/Disability.

Stryker Corporation will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information.
name: Design Engineer-Software

contents:
WHAT WE DO

At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.

Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.

WHO WE LOOK FOR

Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.

YOUR IMPACT

The Securities Settlements Technology team maintains and develops the suite of applications supporting the global securities clearance & settlement process. These applications sit in the broader context of the overall securities trade processing architecture and as such represent an ideal vantage point from which to understand the entire flow in context, from middle office trade processing, asset servicing, funding, & client assets through to the way in which postings downstream influence the books and records of the firm.

The core application, Corona, is a 100% in-house, modern Java-based application with high scalability & throughput, handling millions of transactions daily. There is close collaboration across the global team in Jersey City, Tokyo, Hong Kong, London & Bengaluru both in terms of day-to-day issues & longer-term projects. Tokyo team contributes to global application development as much as teams in other regions. There are many APAC industry changes expected to be implemented by Tokyo team in coming years, as well as many smaller internal initiatives to enable new business, create revenue opportunities, or realise efficiencies.

OUR IMPACT

The Operations Division is the engine room that powers Goldman Sachs, and Operations Engineering is driving their industrialization through automation, digitization and orchestration.

HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL

  • Translate business and technical requirements into well-engineered business applications based on object oriented design.
  • Interface with internal clients/end users and other development teams
  • Participate in the full SDLC for software written with Java, SQL, RESTful web services, RMI, JMS messaging and web UIs.
  • Stay up-to-date on industry driven changes and design globally consistent solutions that meet local requirements.


RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • 2-5 years of experience with object oriented programming in Java, SQL
  • Analytical skills to perform technical and functional analysis with strong communication skills.
  • Experience in test driven development.
  • Strong ownership and teamwork to deliver solution and resolve issues to meet business requirement with strict timelines.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Experience with JMS (messaging), AngularJS, Unix shell scripting is a plus.
  • Experience with platforms within GS is a plus.
  • Language skills in Japanese and/or Cantonese is a plus. Goldman Sachs is an equal opportunity employer.


ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2018. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

contents:
WHAT WE DO

At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.

Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.

WHO WE ARE

Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.

The Operations Division is the engine room that powers Goldman Sachs, and Operations Technology is driving their industrialization through automation, digitization and orchestration

OUR IMPACT

The Post Execution Regulatory Reporting team is seeking talented developers at an exciting time in the evolution of the firm's Trade Processing strategy. As the organisation rethinks the way we source and distribute data, the regulatory reporting agenda is increasingly driving the design and the adoption of new architecture. This covers all aspects of data handling including sourcing, transformation, enrichment, transmission and storage.

Financial Regulators around the world continue to impose new regulatory obligations and evolve existing ones. In response, the firm continues to invest heavily in technology to meet these demands and protect the firm's reputation. The Post Execution Regulatory Reporting team plays a critical role here, developing processes to extract complex data from trading systems in a timely manner. The team is responsible for:

  • Working with Operations / Reg Ops Tech to understand requirements
  • Modelling data - Sourcing data from trading systems
  • Transforming data using Slang/Java

We operate out of New York, London and Bengaluru

YOUR IMPACT

The successful candidate will:
  • Work on the new data modelling and trade processing strategy
  • Gain exposure to the full range of OTC Derivative products, plus Fixed Income Securities
  • Build a wide network by partnering with Front Office, Trade Processing, and Reg Ops technology teams, as well as Operations and Compliance, to implement and support the firm's regulatory commitments
  • Develop regulatory reporting processes capable of publishing accurate and timely information, and respond rapidly when supporting the processes in the production environment


RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL
  • You will work on both new and existing regulatory reporting jurisdictions (including MIFID2), and have the opportunity to work on strategic architecture
  • Work on highly visible projects, which are essential for the firm's commercial and reputational success.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or a related technical field

Company Description
Dropbox is a leading global collaboration platform that's transforming the way people work together, from the smallest business to the largest enterprise. With more than 500 million registered users across more than 180 countries, our mission is to unleash the world's creative energy by designing a more enlightened way of working. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, Dropbox has more than 12 offices around the world.

Team Description
Our Engineering team is working to simplify the way people work together. They're building a family of products that handle over a billion files a day for people around the world. With our broad mission and massive scale, there are countless opportunities to make an impact.

Role Description
Our Web Devsat Dropbox are front-end experts. We use HTML, CSS, Javascript and a/b testing to improve the core flows of our website. As a growth team, we're extremely passionate about fast iteration and high impact code.

Responsibilities

  • You will collaborate with PMs, designers, and conversion marketing to quickly ship new front-end experiments
  • You'll work closely with other engineering teams so you can pioneer new front-end techniques
  • You will write modular, secure, and well-tested front-end code (JS, HTML, and CSS)
  • You'll improve the team and company - you will be an active participant in our culture (mentorship, interviewing, and new initiatives)
Requirements
  • You have 2+ years of industryexperience as a Web Developer usingHTML, CSS and Javascript
  • You've built strong front-end development skills
  • You have a real passion for front-end code
  • You are experiment-driven and you have a collaborative mindset
  • Bachelor degree orequivalentis required for this role
Benefits and Perks
  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time off
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)
Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, Latinx, Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, Women at Dropbox, ATX Diversity (based in Austin, Texas) and the Dropbox Empowerment Network (based in Dublin, Ireland).

  • Using Kafka, Spark Streaming & MemSQL to build a Big-Data processing pipeline that is able to process millions of transactions in near real-time
  • Given a starting portfolio and a target portfolio, generating a set of orders that are compliant to various investment guidelines, leveraging linear programming techniques and industry standard optimizers
  • Scaling a model portfolio of ideal investment to thousands of real client portfolios, while accounting for the specific restrictions and investment objectives of each
  • Creating Platform-As-A-Service offerings including Kafka Clusters, In-Memory Data Stores (Gemfire) & Virtualized Streaming Datasets

contents:
At Northrop Grumman we develop cutting-edge technology that preserves freedom and advances human discovery. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We continue to innovate with developments from launching the first commercial flight to space, to discovering the early beginnings of the universe. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

No matter the assignment, Northrop Grumman is committed to being a leader in Cyber, Logistics and Modernization, Autonomous Systems, C4ISR, and Strike. For us, it's about more than just performing. It means realizing the values that define us: responsibility, trust, integrity and protecting freedom worldwide. These values inspire and unite our people- who make everything we do possible.

The Engineering, Sciences and Technology (ES&T) organization pushes the boundaries of innovation, redefines engineering capabilities, and drives advances in various sciences. Our team is chartered with providing the skills, innovative technologies to develop, design, produce and sustain optimized product lines across the sector while providing a decisive advantage to the warfighter. Come be a part of our mission!

The Bedrock team at Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is looking for you to join our team as a Software I&T Engineer based out of Redondo Beach, CA.

What You'll get to Do:

We are looking for a Software I&T Engineer on the Bedrock Program. Applicant will be working through the early development stage to create test approaches, drivers, automated testing scripts and eventually support verification, deployment. Systems deployed are Linux based and targeted for various cloud and virtual infrastructures. Opportunity to learn to execute remote testing and potential site travel opportunities, but not required. Preferred skilled set includes ability to troubleshoot software and code in scripting language (Python, Java, Perl).

Additional Northrop Grumman Information:

Northrop Grumman has approximately 85,000 employees in all 50 states and in more than 25 countries, we strive to attract and retain the best employees by providing an inclusive work environment wherein employees are receptive to diverse ideas, perspectives and talents to help solve our toughest customer challenges: to develop and maintain some of the most technically sophisticated products, programs and services in the world.

Our Values . The women and men of Northrop Grumman Corporation are guided by Our Values. They describe our company as we want it to be. We want our decisions and actions to demonstrate these Values. We believe that putting Our Values into practice creates long-term benefits for shareholders, customers, employees, suppliers, and the communities we serve.

Our Responsibility . At Northrop Grumman, we are committed to maintaining the highest of ethical standards, embracing diversity and inclusion, protecting the environment, and striving to be an ideal corporate citizen in the community and in the world.

MSSPACEBED
You'll Bring These Qualifications

  • 2 years of System Engineering experience with a Bachelors of Science in a STEM discipline; 0 years of System Engineering experience with Masters;
  • Active DoD Top Secret with an SSBI within the last 6 years
  • Candidate must be an experienced SW integration and testerwith experience in Perl and Java/C++ in a Red Hat Enterprise Linux environment
  • Strong diagnostic/problem solving skills
  • Experience with cloud/virtual infrastructures


These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:
  • Active SCI
  • Demonstrated ability to implement process improvements, streamline activities, and develop efficiencies
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills; strong interpersonal and analytic skills
  • Previous in-depth domain knowledge of program software engineering and test automation preferred
  • Preferred skilled set includes ability to troubleshoot software and code in scripting language (Python, Java, Perl).

What We Can Offer You:

Northrop Grumman provides a comprehensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages your growth and supports the mutual success of our people and our company. Northrop Grumman benefits give you the flexibility and control to choose the benefits that make the most sense for you and your family. Your package will include the following:

  • Health Plan
  • Savings Plan
  • Paid Time Off
  • Additional benefits
    • Education Assistance
    • Training and Development

What We Do

Who We Look For
Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.
The Operations Division is the engine room that powers Goldman Sachs, and Operations Technology is driving their industrialization through automation, digitization and orchestration
The Control Engineering team is responsible for developing and enhancing control implementations and tooling to allow preventative, longitudinal, bilateral, and detective controls to be supported across the front-to-back architecture across Operations Engineering. We undertake a key role in the architecture of the control platforms, and our success contributes directly to the efficient functioning of the firm's trading and sales operations on a day-to-day basis.

The team are responsible for the build out of Trade Tracker and Front-to-Back Trade Search platforms
• Trade Tracking platform: a real-time transaction high volume low latency NoSQL based flow monitoring solution solving the "where's my trade" use case by creating real-time linkages across trade flow and complex event processing breach detection engine to identify blockages / backlogs. Platform eliminates and manages the costly issues by providing visibility on each transaction across our distributed environments through completeness and timeliness controls. Upcoming enhancements include support for 10X volumes (over 100MM) trade activities per day, complex graph based breach detection scenarios and data lake integration. Platform built with ElasticSearch, Redis, Kafka, Esper, REST and many more.
• Front-to-Back Trade Search platform: a trade search tool across Derivative and Security asset classes enabling Sales, Traders and Operations teams to have a Google-style search front-end with a FedEx-like tracking of trades through front-to-back trade processing flow that enables teams to support client queries and trade data analysis significantly uplifting the efficiency. Upcoming enhancements includes support for graphs based model of trade flows, real-time event streaming search corpus enrichment and aggregation and continued build out across all derivative and securities asset classes. Platform built with ElasticSearch, Kafka, Node.JS, AngularJS, Selenium, graph database and many more.

The team is passionate about solving complex technical problems, delivering innovative, resilient and performant systems.

As a member of our team you will work closely with business and technical colleagues locally in London, Warsaw, New York and Bengaluru, to solve challenging technical problems, and deliver cutting-edge technical solutions to meet evolving business demands. Effective problem-solving, consensus building, and a highly-developed analytical and technical skill set are essential to your success.

We run an Agile (Scrum) team with iterative feedback loops with our clients and continual improvement of the team's processes. We are looking for talented engineers who have an insatiable appetite for learning, passionate about building commercial/innovative solutions and developing highly effective teams.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL
• Driven with Strong Analytical, Design & Architecture Skills
• Ability to efficiently work within a global team.
• Effective written and verbal communication skills.
• Good team player and good interpersonal skills.
• Self starter and able to work in a high paced environment.
• Must be willing to handle first line support calls and work on a support rota
• Maintain a focus on quality, attention to detail, communication and delivery to tight timescales.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR
• 2+ years of experience in developing Core Java and Web applications
• Webapp development using HTML5/AngularJS
• Strong skills in Web services, JDBC, Spring, Hibernate (or similar ORM), Design Patterns & solid skills in XML.
• Strong OO design skills and experience
• Familiarity with testing frameworks (JUnit/TestNG/Mokito/Fitnesse/Cucumber) and concepts (Test Driven Development, Regression and Parametric Testing)
• Strong working knowledge of RDBMS (Sybase / DB2) skills including transact SQL
• Strong Linux / Unix skills including scripting (shell), Maven

Preferred Qualifications
• Strong working knowledge of Big Data and NoSQL Solutions (Elastic Search, Hadoop) includes MapReduce, Hive, Spark
• Knowledge of Business Process Management solutions such as JBPM
• Knowledge of financial markets would be an advantage
• Knowledge of workflow solutions using BPMN (eg jBPM, Camunda)
• Experience in Kafka Streaming / Sparking Streaming / Akka

contents:
LendKey is solving a complex challenge - to improve lives with lending made simple - by helping financial institutions compete in the digital age and provide a delightful customer experience, while providing borrowers with the simple, transparent, digital borrowing experience they have come to expect and desire. LendKey works with hundreds of credit unions and banks to conduct their consumer loan programs.

This is a hands-on Engineering role that will focus on solving complex technical problems and creating scalable solutions for our platform. This person will help lead one of our cross-functional squads, which is staffed with a Product Manager, Business Analyst, and one or more engineers.

  • Design and develop high quality and extensible applications
  • Lead a cross-functional squad in story-mapping and functional requirements exercises; in certain cases sharing the responsibilities with the product owner; participate in release plan overview as well as identifying areas of risk & exposure in group discussions
  • Code at least 70% of the time and often more
  • While we expect collaboration within our development squads, the lead software engineer has the responsibility to assign engineering resources to execute the backlog. They are responsible for execution
  • Work with stakeholders to define technical options and agree on solutions
  • Ensure that the squad follows good engineering practices
  • Communicate the status of their backlog to stakeholders both within and outside Engineering. Our technical leads know how to manage their squads and their customers.
  • Mentor & motivate less-experienced squad members to enhance code quality and velocity; lead by example
  • Keep a continuous line of feedback open with their direct manager and the Head of Engineering on squad progress, escalating areas of concern on an ongoing basis; communicate standing of work-in-progress and initiatives to the business periodically
  • Lead in retrospectives, sprint planning, and sprint reviews for the squad
  • Help to direct dedicated QA testing resources for the squad you're working on
  • Lead cross functional squad through the SDLC; collaborate with product owners, technical team members, business stakeholders and designers to implement enhancements or new applications
  • Propose innovative solutions to complex problems
  • Work closely with local and remote squad and team members and management, to achieve high team morale and productivity
  • Share best practices and improve processes within and across development squads
  • Add new functionality to our Loan Servicing and Financial Operations platform
  • Create technical documentation related to new functionality you add to the platform
  • Complete version control and deployment build requirements
  • Interact with our business stakeholders
  • Participate in weekly team project meetings
Requirements
Culture Fit:

Strong desire to work for a mission-based organization that emphasizes the importance of providing exceptional customer service and adherence to our core values: Truthful at all times; Helpful to teammates, clients, and customers; Present , committed & engaged to their teams and work; Driven to be courageous to make an impact; and Diligent & conscientious in executing every element of work.

Technical/Business Experience:

  • Experience leading an engineering team
  • Bachelor's degree preferred
  • 5 or more years of professional experience building business applications using Access/VBA
  • Experience with SQL Server or MySQL, including creation of stored procedures
  • Familiar with use of ADO objects to manipulate recordsets and call stored procedures
  • Familiar with HTML
  • Experience with some form of version control/tracking
  • Experience with Jira or other ticket-management tools
name: Lead Software Engineer - Desktop

contents:
A company with a mission to make the world a safer place…
Headquartered in NYC, Qrypt is a tech startup quietly operating in stealth mode. Qrypt’s mission is to secure high-value information indefinitely with a revolutionary encryption protocol impervious to cyber-attacks today and threats posed by quantum computers in the future. Demonstrated by a deep commitment to global privacy and safety, Qrypt’s employees embrace the exciting challenge of forging new paths and mastering technologies grounded in the fundamentals of mathematics and physics. The company highly prizes the value of teamwork and encourages intellectual curiosity and continual growth for each of its employees.

Our Engineering Team:
We are looking for Software Engineers to join our agile development team located in downtown Manhattan. We are building the next generation of cryptography focused on protecting our user’s data from all enemies, foreign and domestic. We build, design, and deploy bulletproof systems and looking for engineers who are ready for that challenge.

Our engineers play a meaningful role in the creation of our product. They are involved in all aspects of the product development lifecycle resulting in an environment where they can take control, maintain ownership over their work, embrace risks and curiosity. We nurture a learning environment and welcome a diverse range of perspectives. 

At Qrypt, our engineers come from all walks of life and understand the value of diversity and inclusion; it’s rooted in our DNA! If you are interested in working on a challenging problem whose solution will have an impact at a global level, then we encourage you to read on and apply! 

About the Role
As a Software Engineer, you will design and implement a cryptographic platform with new and advanced algorithms. You will be encouraged to work collaboratively with our team in order to design architectural and infrastructural improvements. You will build systems that deliver high-quality, high-availability services.

About you:
Due to the nature of our product, employees must have the ability to obtain a security clearance. 

  • 3-8 years of experience in software development with increased responsibility.
  • Proven ability to continuously learn, work independently, and make decisions with minimal supervision. You understand that making mistakes means you’re learning, and you actively seek opportunities to grow and develop.
  • Strong engineering background with preferred fields in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Software Engineering.
  • You want to work on a product that will impact the world and you're curious about post-quantum cryptography.
  • Ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical teams. You enjoy collaboration with others—we don’t get work done in an assembly line; success is achieved because everyone pitches in.
  • You care about quality regardless of the toolbox you are using. We are looking for people who build solid maintainable systems.
  • Comfortable working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives.
  • We welcome Software Engineers with a strong software development background, who are deeply interested in continuous learning and have an innovative spirit that drives them forward.  
  • Experience with Python and/or C/C++, CentOS/Redhat; Flask; NGINX; Redis; RabbitMQ, Azure, Docker
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline or equivalent practical experience. 

Desirable skills:
Experience in agile environments.
 Experience deploying and running a live service.

Reasons to work with us:
At Qrypt, we offer fair and competitive pay.
 Unlimited PTO: We realize you’ll be working hard. As a thank you, we have a flexible unlimited vacation policy.
Free lunch and snacks to keep us going.
 Medical and dental plan participation because health matters.
Your future is important to us; we offer a 401K matching program.
 But above all, be part of an amazing team. Together, we’ll make this world a safer place.

Hearst Magazines Digital Media reaches more than 100 million people around the world every month on digital platforms connected to loved and trusted brands like Cosmopolitan, Delish, Esquire, Elle, Runner's World, and 29 television stations.

You'll join a diverse, supportive community of engineers who are creating a modern content technology stack - built from the ground up - to give our users, editors, and advertisers tools that enable them to tell amazing stories. We're using modern web technologies to do this, like React, Webpack, Javascript (ES6) and Python. We're building an open, service-oriented platform driven by APIs, and believe in crafting simple, elegant solutions to complex technological and product problems.

Our ideal candidate is a passionate full stack software engineer who is eager to learn and contribute to team success.

We're looking for someone who can quickly pick up a new framework and implement thoughtful solutions within it, writing clean, object-oriented code. We believe that the best candidate will be considerate of their teammates and highly value collaboration.

Responsibilities:
• Be part of a development team that innovates and creates modern tools and features that will be used across the entire Hearst content platform.
• Participate in key software design, working directly with other engineers, the product team, devops, and the editorial team.
• Develop and optimize an ES6 video player and other high-visibility video services.

Desired Qualities:
• Takes initiative to constantly improve individually and as a part of a team.
• Has experience in a role building software for consumer-facing web applications, preferably large-scale and content-focused.
• Has the ability to take a feature or service to full completion, from working with our back-end tech through front-end implementation.
• Has 4 years of Javascript / front-end development experience.
• Has solid Python, PHP, or other back-end development experience.
• Is eager to learn any other languages/frameworks that apply.
• Is excited to mentor and collaborate with less experienced engineers.

Bonus Points for:
• Templating / SaaS design / Twig
• RESTful API integration
• React, Vue.js, or other reactive Javascript framework experience
• Distributed service oriented architecture systems
• Relational databases / data models
• Working in an Agile development team (Scrum highly desired)
• Performance tuning / caching strategies
• ES6 standards
• Linux / Elixir / Backbone.js / Node.js
• A degree in Computer Science or a related field

*This position will be located either at the Hearst Tower in NYC or in our Center Valley, PA office.

Consumer and Commercial Banking (CCBD)
Consumer and Commercial Banking brings innovative solutions to traditional banking activities. We are a global team of lenders, investors, risk managers, skilled marketers, web experts and banking specialists. We provide a suite of solutions to help our customers meet their personal financial goals. We make direct investments in, and risk manage, a portfolio of corporate loans and securities. And we help transform distressed communities through investments and loans of private capital.

Digital Finance
Digital Finance, a business unit within CCBD, is comprised of the firm's digitally-led consumer businesses, which include the Marcus deposits and lending businesses, as well as the personal financial management app, Clarity Money. Digital Finance combines the strength and heritage of a 148-year-old financial institution with the agility and entrepreneurial spirit of a tech start-up. Through the use of machine learning and intuitive design, we provide customers with powerful tools that are grounded in value, transparency and simplicity to help them make smarter decisions about their money.

Clarity Money is a business recently acquired by Goldman Sachs that offers a revolutionary AI- and machine learning-based product for consumers to improve their financial health. Ushering in a new era of mobile personal finance management apps, Clarity Money uses artificial intelligence and data science to help consumers make smarter financial decisions and get the most from their money. The revolutionary features allow users to cancel bills, get a better credit card and create a savings account, all from within the app, and all at the push of a button.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL

• The developer will be a key member of the Clarity Money marketing team and instrumental in the scalable growth of our business

• Own the communication development cycle including translating design requirements to fully dynamic and responsive campaigns, ensuring proper rendering of content, and testing for successful delivery through our CRM (Braze)
• Develop landing pages on our web platform for all communications
• Work with back-end engineering and development teams to document, prioritize, and implement new customer attributes and event triggers to create an end-to-end personalized experience for our users
• Create and manage repository of email templates to create a fully scalable marketing execution organization
• Create an email QA process to ensure proper rendering and data population
• Deploy conversion pixels through tag management systems such as Google Tag Manager
• Implement integrations between analytics and other 3rd party tools such as Braze, Facebook Ads Manager, Segment, etc.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR
• Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology or related field of study
• 2+ years of experience in web development
• 2+ years working with JavaScript in the client or on the server
• Expert understanding of fundamental HTML and CSS
• Experience working in an Agile environment with project management /agile / kanban tools like JIRA & Confluence
• Experience working with and writing REST APIs
• Experience with Mobile Application (iPhone/ Android) development of marketing technology tools
• Working knowledge of design tools including Sketch & Photoshop

OUR IMPACT

The Structured Products engineering team at Goldman Sachs is responsible for designing and building front to back, highly scalable technology solutions that will allow the business to significantly grow and transform the marketplace. This covers everything from market making, pricing, client distribution and client engagement through to document generation, product issuance, trade booking, lifecycle and trade confirmations.

Innovation and ambition is central to our delivery and SPACE is one example of this - -- a powerful, easy-to-use, collaborative tool that transforms and simplifies our retail client experience. SPACE supports the full trading lifecycle from idea generation and price discovery through primary and secondary trading and lifecycle management; making trading simple, transparent and more efficient and providing access to Goldman Sachs and third party content.

YOUR IMPACT

As an engineer within Structured Products engineering, you will be working closely with our sales, trading, product origination and operations teams to create a highly automated platform to drive expansion of the client offering into new products and markets whilst using leading open source technologies in combination with proprietary platforms.

We are pursuing engineers across the stack who enjoy working in a client driven and agile environment; from those who are confident developing low latency, scalable and resilient enterprise solutions through to individuals passionate in implementing responsive user interfaces.

contents:
Working in Northrop Grumman Mission Systems means making a direct contribution to mission projects that keep our homeland safe, expanding the boundaries of possibility, and reshaping the world we live in. If you're looking for challenging work experiences with a bigger purpose and desire to learn in a collaborative environment, we invite you to look for the next step in your career at Northrop Grumman.

Northrop Grumman's Software Engineers work in collaborative, team-based environments to design, develop, and assure high-performing software systems. You will have the opportunity to be a flexible self-starter, working to create
solutions that keep our armed services safe and battle-ready around the world. We encourage innovation and forward thinking and expect our developers to take a high level of ownership throughout the software life cycle.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Participate in the entire lifecycle of software development from requirements definition to integration & deployment
  • Apply systems thinking to ensure our products are scalable, maintainable, and meet end-user needs
  • Communicate openly and effectively with teammates and customer representatives
As a full-time employee of Northrop Grumman Mission Systems, you are eligible for our robust benefits package including:
  • Medical, Dental & Vision coverage
  • 401k
  • Educational Assistance
  • Life Insurance
  • Employee Assistance Programs & Work/Life Solutions
  • Paid Time Off
  • Health & Wellness Resources
  • Employee Discounts
This position's standard work schedule is a 9/80. The 9/80 schedule allows employees who work a nine-hour day Monday through Thursday to take every other Friday off.

This requisition may be filled at a higher grade based on qualifications listed below.

HUNTSALMSTR
Basic Qualifications:
This requisition may be filled at either a level 2 or a level 3.
  • BQs for a Software Engineer 2 are 2 Years of relevant experience with Bachelors in Science in preferably in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Math (STEM) discipline; 0 Years with Masters
  • BQs for a Software Engineer 3 are 5 Years of relevant experience with Bachelors in Science in preferably in a Science,Technology, Engineering or Math (STEM) discipline; 3 Years with Masters; 0 with PhD
  • Experience developing software in object-oriented programming languages such as Java, C++, C#, or Ada.
  • Ability to obtain a Secret Security Clearance.
  • Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with technical teams.
  • Ability to prioritize and adjust tasks to accomplish project results.
  • Experience analyzing complex problems and developing solutions.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience with the Missile Defense and Sense & Warn based systems.
  • Experience with international sensors and fire control systems.
  • Development utilizing a Linux based development environment.
  • Knowledge of various scripting languages and tools: Python, MATLAB, etc.
  • Experience working on CMMI Level 3+ programs
  • Familiarity with Agile software development practices.
  • Proven communications skills with armed services & government customer.
  • Active Secret (or above) Security Clearance.

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.${descr2}${descr3}

contents:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mprYM6eTwoc
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems in air and space that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our work preserves freedom and democracy, and advances human discovery and our understanding of the universe. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have a lot of fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.
Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems located in Oklahoma City, OK has an opening for a Software Engineer 4. Position will have primary responsibility in the development and support of applications that track requirements and integration with industry standard Agile software tools that software maintenance and upgrades for the B-2 bomber.
Essential Functions:
- Analyze, design, develop, test, modify and maintain embedded applications and support tools utilizing software engineering best practices and standards; participating in the full life-cycle activities of software development to include requirements, modeling, design, implementation, unit and integration test, release, installation and maintenance in an Agile development paradigm.
- The candidate will participate in Agile scrum teams developing high quality products to our customers.
- Will serve in a leadership role on software development efforts.
- Mentoring more junior engineers.

Basic Qualifications:
* Bachelor's Degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics discipline from an accredited university and 9+ years (Bachelors) or 7+ years (Masters) or 4+ years (PhD) of software engineering experience.
* Understanding of, and extensive experience with, tools that track and implement requirements is required.
* Security Requirements:

Candidate must have an active DoD Secret or Top Secret and a background investigation within the scope of five years. Candidate must be able to obtain and maintain all required security clearances and program specific accesses.

Preferred Qualifications:

* Experience in object-oriented analysis and design.
* Experience developing software with C/C++ - targeted for Linux or an RTOS environment
* Experience with Agile software development and Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket, Bamboo, Fisheye, etc.)
* Experience with Rhapsody modeling for software design
* Experience with DOORS for software requirements
* Familiarity with test automation frameworks
* Excellent oral and written communication skills with strong interpersonal skills
* Experience with Green Hills Integrity, VxWorks or service oriented architectures preferred
* Experience developing software for embedded systems preferred

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. name: Engineer Software 4

contents:
Job Description

Who we want

Dedicated achievers. Relentless about quality, people who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure a project is complete and meets regulations and expectations.

Goal-oriented developers. Keeping the customer and system requirements squarely in focus, people who deliver safe and robust solutions.

Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to develop best practices.

What you will do

As a Test Engineer, you will lead the design, development and implementation of test systems and test equipment for US and global service depots, to enable the repair of Stryker products around the world. You will be an SME in the electrical and software design of test systems. Our ideal candidate will demonstrate strong leadership qualities, serve as technical lead advisor, and partner with a cross-functional team.

Some of your other responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

  • Develop user requirements
  • Create mechanical and electrical design for test systems
  • Architect, write and debug software for test systems
  • Perform test systems validation
  • Partner with external vendor on design and/or validation, as appropriate
  • Monitor and control progress of projects to ensure sound application of engineering principles are used and design intent is being followed
  • Coordinates with other units, vendors and senior leadership as needed to ensure specific cost, time and/or regulatory standards are met
  • Partner with appropriate other engineering disciplines like Product Engineering, RA, QA, AO, Operations Engineering, Advanced Sourcing, Service Operations Engineering, external vendors and International teams

What you need
  • B.S. in Electrical or Computer Engineering
  • 6 or more years of experience; Masters of Science with 5 years experience; PhD with 2 or more years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Demonstrated electrical design and software programming expertise (preferred experience with LabVIEW and/or .NET)
  • Expertise in product safety testing (e.g. IEC 60601)
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills
  • Demonstrated mechanical/electrical design and problem solving skills
  • Experience working in a regulated industry


Work From Home: No

Travel Percentage: Up to 25%

Stryker Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Stryker is an EO employer - M/F/Veteran/Disability.

Stryker Corporation will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information.

contents:
What We Do

At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.

Consumer and Commercial Banking (CCBD) brings innovative solutions to traditional banking activities. We are a global team of lenders, investors, risk managers, skilled marketers, web experts and banking specialists. We provide a suite of solutions to help our customers meet their personal financial goals. We make direct investments in, and risk manage, a portfolio of corporate loans and securities. And we help transform distressed communities through investments and loans of private capital.

Digital Finance, a business unit within CCBD, is comprised of the firm's digitally-led consumer businesses, which include the Marcus deposits and lending businesses, as well as the personal financial management app, Clarity Money. Digital Finance combines the strength and heritage of a 148-year-old financial institution with the agility and entrepreneurial spirit of a tech start-up. Through the use of machine learning and intuitive design, we provide customers with powerful tools that are grounded in value, transparency and simplicity to help them make smarter decisions about their money. Clarity Money is a business recently acquired by Goldman Sachs that offers a revolutionary AI- and machine learning-based product for consumers to improve their financial health. Ushering in a new era of mobile personal finance management apps, Clarity Money uses artificial intelligence and data science to help consumers make smarter financial decisions and get the most from their money. The revolutionary features allow users to cancel bills, get a better credit card and create a savings account, all from within the app, and all at the push of a button.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL

• The Clarity Money team is actively seeking a motivated Android Engineer with proven industry experience
• The ideal candidate is a strong individual contributor, positive team player and willing to get things done. Strong computer science fundamentals are key to success in this role
• We are hard at work building out our Android application, but need an additional Senior member of the team. We have an iOS app released, which is doing very well, so many of the platform dependencies are clearly defined
• In addition to helping build out the MVP release, be a part of defining and building brand new features
• We have a lot to build for our users, and being a new company with a fresh code base, we have many opportunities to build and establish great engineering practices and solutions on top of a solid foundation
• Your ideas and input are valued. The more you are engaged and take ownership, the more you are able to guide and influence what we do. Join our smart and motivated team and be a part of a rapidly growing product and company
• Be the hands-on performer on various process improvement efforts and collaborate with teammates on efficiency and run the engine initiatives

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR

• 5+ years experience in software development
• 3+ years experience in native Android development
• You know how to architect applications that interface with REST APIs, persist data, and present information to complex UI layouts applying solid software patterns and architecture appropriate for Android
• Knowing how to read and understand Swift code and iOS projects a plus
• You build modular, reusable, and tested code
• Experience with unit, integration and UI testing
• You know how to avoid massive activities and understand concurrency, memory management, retain cycles, data modeling, and using stable third party libraries to build excellent solutions rapidly
• You know how to lead features from inception to deployment, but you also like to keep your hands dirty in code and technical problems
• You have extensive experience in all the core Android technologies and popular third party toolsets
• Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field of study
• Demonstrated leadership experience

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.

contents:
Handy is on a mission to change the way the world purchases home services. We operate in all major US cities and several locations in Canada and Europe, but we are just getting started. At the heart of our mission is a resilient platform built on a sound technical foundation. We are looking for strong technical leaders to join us in our mission.

At Handy, we form small (around five engineers), high-impact teams and empower them to iterate rapidly. You'll lead and mentor one of these teams. You will be collaborating with the product development, business operations, and customer experience teams everyday, and you'll make a tremendous impact on both tactical and strategic direction of our platform and products.

What you will do:

  • Lead, mentor, and develop a world-class engineering team
  • Influence and empower the team to ensure they do the right thing
  • Play a key role in the architectural and design decisions your team makes and be able to articulate the impact of those decisions to the rest of the Handy team
  • Be a hands-on contributor to the team and lead by example
  • Be responsible for operating what you and your team built in production
  • Contribute to code and design reviews, evangelize best engineering practices, and lead Handy Lunch & Learn sessions
  • Ensure our customers and professionals continue enjoying the best possible experience

Who you are:
  • Strong software engineer with at least five years of hands-on development experience
  • Well-versed in at least one OO language: Ruby, Python, Java, etc.
  • BS or MS in Computer Science or a related field
  • At least spent a year leading and mentoring a small team of engineers
  • Ability to work with and effectively communicate across multiple technical and non-technical teams
  • Willingness to learn and apply new skills and technologies
  • Experience working at a growth-stage startup is a plus

About Handy

Our mission is to change the way the world purchases home services. Since all work and no play makes for a dull office, we're committed to creating an environment that's as fun as it is productive. That means we fill our days with food, surprises, brain-stimulating activities, beer and wine for those who want it, a whisky club (complete with commemorative glasses), seriously competitive foosball, and so much more. As a member of the team at Handy, you can look forward to all of that every single day, and tons of other special events and outings sprinkled throughout the weeks.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
name: Senior Software Engineer

contents:
Software Engineer, Web Services Platform

About the team:

The Web Services Platform team is responsible for making service and API development at AppNexus faster, more effective, and higher quality. We support the UI and API product development teams by investing in application development frameworks, infrastructure, and tools.

About the job:

As a developer on our team you’ll design and implement solutions that are high quality, easy to operate and maintain, and make the lives of product engineers easier. Projects can be in a variety of languages with different operational requirements, so you’ll need to approach problems from a variety of ways.

Projects could include:

  • Implementing a service mesh layer to handle discovery and load balancing for microservices.
  • Improving an API framework so product developers can more quickly get to production.
  • Replacing a home-grown service router with an off-the-shelf open source system.
  • Implementing a data service that exposes a GraphQL interface and autoprovisions customer data storage in multiple DCs, world-wide.


About your skills and experience:

  • 3+ years of experience as a professional software developer
  • Proficiency in Node.js or a systems language like Java
  • Experience building and operating SaaS services
  • Familiarity with Linux
  • Experience designing HTTP+JSON APIs a plus
  • Experience with docker or Kubernetes a plus


More about you:

  • You are passionate about a culture of learning and teaching. You love challenging yourself to constantly improve, and sharing your knowledge to empower others
  • You like to take risks when looking for novel solutions to complex problems. If faced with roadblocks, you continue to reach higher to make greatness happen
  • You care about solving big, systemic problems. You look beyond the surface to understand root causes so that you can build long-term solutions for the whole ecosystem
  • You believe in not only serving customers, but also empowering them by providing knowledge and tools


AppNexus is proud to offer equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We strive to foster a diverse, inclusive and engaging work environment. We welcome applications from all candidates and look forward to receiving yours! Our diversity in action:
  • Partnering with Path Forward to offer returnships to help caregivers reenter the workforce
  • Sharing feedback openly through roundtable discussions on how to make progress on our Diversity & Inclusion goals
  • Galvanizing diversity and inclusion through our affinity groups (including OutNexus, AppNexus Women’s Network, AppNexus Latino Alliance and BlackNexus to name just a few!)
  • Partnering with Fairygodboss to support our commitment to women’s advancement in tech
